item.title: Substance on street, 16th September
item.description:
A person keeps putting a lot of red powder on the pavements, which is a danger to dogs and possibly people.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Credon Road, Bermondsey, London

item.title: Matrass dumped by lamppost close to communal bins on Innes Street, 16th September
item.description:
Hi there, someone has flytipped a matrass by the lamppost next to the communal bins on Innes Street. Please could this be cleared away. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Innes Street, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole on Moorgate going north at junction with London Wall in cycle box, 16th September
item.description:
At the front of the cycle box at the traffic lights on Moorgate going north at the junction with London Wall there is a large pothole next to a vent which makes it very dangerous for bikes starting to cycle with cars and buses close behind.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London Wall, City of London

item.title: Lamp post light out, 16th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Sherwood Close, Blendon, London

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 66, Lennard Road, Penge, London

item.title: Non-household waste in the communal bin area of Clifford House, mattresses, shelves, drawers ect., 16th September
item.description:
The communal bin area in my block of flats (1 Calverley Close, Clifford House, Beckenham) has been used for fly tipping for the past several months. I have attached a photo of a notice that Riverside (our estate management company) put up highlighting the problem, but that's done nothing to deter the individuals. It's now reached a point where the bin area is completely overflowing as nothing has been collected, presumably because the waste collectors won't empty it as there's so much non-household rubbish there. The smell is becoming an issue but the more pressing concern is the vermin being attracted by all the waste, namely rats and foxes. The bins haven't been emptied for at 3 weeks now so I've sent this report to bring the issue to your attention as it is now a matter of public health concern, I hope to hear back from you soon, Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Calverley Close, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The Ballard is leaning over towards the main road, 16th September

item.title: Household Waste Dumped at Base of Wheathill Road Sign, 16th September
item.description:
A pile of household rubbish — including bottles, packaging, and a white bucket — has been dumped right beneath the Wheathill Road sign. This spot is now so frequently used by flytippers it’s practically a public bin. The council’s failure to act is enabling repeat offenders and degrading our neighbourhood.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wheathill Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wheelie bins left on street, 16th September
item.description:
Two wheelie bins outside 40 Morpeth Road, constantly left on street obstructing pavement, causing public nuisance. Left out for several months.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Morpeth Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Dog barking constantly, and left outside all the time alone, 16th September
item.description:
A dog has been left in the garden of 136/136a Brooke Road. It’s alone all day and night, it barks constantly whenever anyone passes by. I’m worried about its safety and quality of life. The noise of the barking is very disruptive for neighbours too.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Norcott Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 16th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Merino Place, Blackfen, London

item.title: Pedestrian button for traffic light not working, 16th September
item.description:
The pedestrian traffic lights button closest to sainsburys is non functional (for about 2 weeks). All other buttons seem to work. What I noticed is that if this button is pressed it does not make the lights go green after a full cycle of traffic has gone through. And fhe lights on the box containing the button do not light up after the button is pressed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2a, Brondesbury Road, Queen's Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet
